intro: Cyclopia laxiflora, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a perennial herb native to the Western Cape region of South Africa. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces small, spherical seed pods that split open to release seeds when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in fynbos vegetation. Cyclopia laxiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine.
